content.raw:
In fact, `SetForce` and `SetTorque` shouldn't be called at all from plugins as the underlying ODE methods `dBodySetForce` and `dBodySetForce` overwrite the accumulated vectors instead of adding forces and torques:

From http://opende.sourceforge.net/docs/group__bodies.html:
> ODE_API void dBodySetForce (dBodyID b, dReal x, dReal y, dReal z)

> Set the body force accumulation vector.

> Remarks:
> This is mostly useful to zero the force and torque for deactivated bodies before they are reactivated, in the case where the force-adding functions were called on them while they were deactivated.

If multiple plugins apply forces to a link or joint, the resulting behavior will be undefined and depend on the order in which the plugins get updated.

In fact, SetForce and SetTorque shouldn't be called at all from plugins as the underlying ODE methods dBodySetForce and dBodySetForce overwrite the accumulated vectors instead of adding forces and torques:

From http://opende.sourceforge.net/docs/group__bodies.html:

ODE_API void dBodySetForce (dBodyID b, dReal x, dReal y, dReal z)

Set the body force accumulation vector.

Remarks: This is mostly useful to zero the force and torque for deactivated bodies before they are reactivated, in the case where the force-adding functions were called on them while they were deactivated.

If multiple plugins apply forces to a link or joint, the resulting behavior will be undefined and depend on the order in which the plugins get updated.
